title.narrative: IN Mica 2021: ILO - Elimination of WFCL in the Mica mining belt in Jharkhand, India

description.narrative: The proposed project is an expansion of the Mica programme in India to address worst forms of child labour through community empowerment and comprehensive advocacy and lobbying approach in 15 new villages. The project will strive to accomplish a “mica supply chain free from child labour” by promoting vibrant community-based organisations, well equipped CSOs (Civil Society Organisations), strong CSO network and strengthening the MSP (Multi Stakeholder Platform).
Expenditure 2021

title.narrative: CSOs and CSO networks have acquired capacities to protect, advocate to uphold child rights and develop networking with the relevant forums/networks.

description.narrative: CSOs and CSO networks have acquired capacities to protect, advocate to uphold child rights and develop networking with the relevant forums/networks.

title.narrative: # of CSO representatives /CSOs effectively engaged

description.narrative: # of CSO representatives /CSOs effectively engaged

comment.narrative: The reason for excess utilization in this quarter is due to felt need to strengthen collective approach among all CSOs working in mica mining areas to strengthen and consolidate the collective efforts on elimination of WFCL' through exchanging and showcasing the best practices among NGO domain as well as duty bearers.;

The reasons for less utilisation are inability to conduct in-person consultation and capacity building activities for the CSO network due to COVID-19 restrictions and CSO netwrok members were preoccupied with ongoing study on Mica dependency and organisation level operational challenges (changes in FCRA regulations).;

title.narrative: Children forum (Balmanch) is constituted in all 15 villages and gradually adopts procedures for effective functioning.

description.narrative: Children forum (Balmanch) is constituted in all 15 villages and gradually adopts procedures for effective functioning.

title.narrative: # of children trained as agents of change

description.narrative: # of children trained as agents of change

comment.narrative: The reason for excess utilisation in this quarter is due to the intense capacity building needs of newly consituited balamch in 15 villages required for the agreed deliverable to streamline the process for emergence of a vibrant Balmanch as one of desired deliverables of the of the project in phase 1 ( October 2021 to March 2022).;

The reason for less utilisation is due to conducting capacity building activities for children in smaller groups and of shorter session (as opposed to planned training for all at common place) due to COVID-19 restrictions.;

The reasons for less utilisation are due to conducting capacity building sessions of shorter duration due to COVID-19 restriction.;

comment.narrative: Outcome is not reported in the PRIMAS. Kindly guide me how to report. The achievements will be reported through annual evaluation in September 2022;

title.narrative: Exploited/abused children have access to formal mainstream education

description.narrative: Exploited/abused children have access to formal mainstream education

title.narrative: # vulnerable girls received educational services

description.narrative: # vulnerable girls received educational services

comment.narrative: During the quarter 720 girls were with educational materials but these are not the new ones and hence no report under achievement column. The reason for excess utilization in the quarter is due to felt needs to ensure improved access to formal education for all school going age children. Resumption of academic activities after a gap of 22 months needed a great deal of efforts to create children friendly learning environment as well as encourage the children to access adequate study materials (including mobile library with academic supplements.;

The reason for less utilisation is due to mainstream educational institutions remained closed for learning/academic activities for children. The project has planned to equip the schools with mutually agreed and need based TLMs (Teaching and Learning Materials) but could not be done. It shall be done in next qtr as schools are expected to resume normal functioning from next qtr.;

description.narrative: # exploited/ abused children participated in awareness raising session

comment.narrative: The reason for excess utilisation in the quarter is due to huge needs to conduct intensice community levelo sessions -on child rights and child protectuon issues aftter lifting of COVid -19 restrictions. These sessions helped to create alterness among children, their parents and the duty bearers to ensure protection rights of children are duly safeguarded.;
The reasons for less utilisation are due to conducting awareness sessions in small groups and of shorter duration.;

title.narrative: # of families of exploited/abused children participated in income generating activities

description.narrative: # of families of exploited/abused children participated in income generating activities

comment.narrative: The reason for less utilisation is due to more time (than anticipated) to establish effective functioning of the newly constituted SHGs (Self Help Groups) . Preparatory processes have been completed and support to strengthen IGA will be provided in coming month.;

title.narrative: Families with children vulnerable to exploitation are trained to undertake additional livelihood options.

description.narrative: Families with children vulnerable to exploitation are trained to undertake additional livelihood options.

title.narrative: # of community members with children vulnerable to exploitation trained for additional livelihood activities

description.narrative: # of community members with children vulnerable to exploitation trained for additional livelihood activities

comment.narrative: 1)More coverage is due to felt need of rebuilding livelihoods for the families through value addition as well as resource support. 2)The reason for excess utilisation in this quarter is due to felt need to rebuild livelihood options ( due to redcued income/loss of livelihoods during COVID -19 times) through intensive community level trainings (by seeking services of technical experts from diversified areas) , extensive demonstration as well as extending resource support from the project to ensure that families continue to pursue options to enhance their family income and take care of educational needs of their children.;

The reason for less utilisation is due to more time (than anticipated) on organising skill building sessions in smaller groups across all 15 villages (as opposed to 3-4 venues) and the planned technical support (veterinary and selected non -farm IGA) to organise these training. But resource persons/trainers were not available in the scheduled time. However it shall be completed with 1st month of next quarter.;

title.narrative: Improved functional capacities of VLCPC (Village Level Child Protection Committees)

description.narrative: Improved functional capacities of VLCPC (Village Level Child Protection Committees)

title.narrative: # child protection committees supported

description.narrative: # child protection committees supported

comment.narrative: The reasons for less utilisation are due to conducting capacity building sessions of shorter duration due to COVID-19 restriction. Further these committees are expected to reconsituted (as elections to 3-tier PRIs is due since past 6 months) and it shall need more intensive capacity building sessions in coming months.;

title.narrative: Multi Stakeholder Platform (MSP) adopts procedures for effective functioning with special mention of active participation of private sector.

description.narrative: Multi Stakeholder Platform (MSP) adopts procedures for effective functioning with special mention of active participation of private sector.

title.narrative: # of private sector representatives sensitised

description.narrative: # of private sector representatives sensitised

comment.narrative: The reason for less utilisation in this quarter is due to less consulative sessions among stakeholders as Government announcement on formalization of Mica collection is being awaited since few months.;

The reason for less utilisation is due to not being able to organise consultative sessions as draft mica policy is still under consideration at State level. However informal meetings were done at district level.;

title.narrative: The project has improved coordination and linkages with the Government authorities,

description.narrative: The project has improved coordination and linkages with the Government authorities,

title.narrative: # of government officials sensitised

description.narrative: # of government officials sensitised

comment.narrative: The reason for excess utilization in this quarter is due to felt need to facilitate the communities to access the entitlements available under mainstream Government schemes. Further project encouraged the communities to participate and mobilise the intensive fortnightly campaign ' Government at your door steps 'by the Government of Jharkhand. In addition, after resuming of normalcy (after 2nd week of February 2022), project organized consultative sessions at block, district level with involvement of key stakeholders (with special mention of DLSAs in Koderma and Giridih districts).;

The reason for less utilisation is due to restrictions on organising formal consulative sessions with the officials at a common place due to COVID -19 restrictions. The project resorted to informal and locatlised sessions (block level. district level) and small sessions at community level to inform about Government mainstream social welfare /social protection schemes. In addition, the project encouraged communities to attend Statewide campaign ( Government at Door step) to inform and facilitate increased access to outreach services/facilities.;

title.narrative: Vulnerable children have improved access to preschool learning through effective functioning of anganwadi centers (Govt. pre school learning center) and widespread adaptation of community-led (including home based ECE).

description.narrative: Vulnerable children have improved access to preschool learning through effective functioning of anganwadi centers (Govt. pre school learning center) and widespread adaptation of community-led (including home based ECE).

title.narrative: # vulnerable girls received educational services

description.narrative: # vulnerable girls received educational services

comment.narrative: During the quarter 652 girls reached but only 417 were the new ones. The reason for excess utilization in the quarter is due to huge needs to strengthen pre school learning facilities both at institutional levels and community level (homebased ECE).The needs could be attributed to the fact that preschool learning facilities and service providers needed more support (capacity building as well as availability of teaching and learning materials - to create and strengthen child friendly and joyful learning environment. It was also one of the deliverable during the Phase 1 .0 (October 2021 to March 2022) and institutional pre school learning centered resumed activities for children from 2nd week of February 2022.;

The reason for less utilisation is due to learning instituitions remained closed for learning/academic activities for children. The project has planned to equip the learning centers with agespecific TLMs (Teaching and Learning Materials) but could not be done. It shall be done in next qtr as learning centers are expected to resume normal functioning. However for younger children (3-6 years) the project promoted homebased ECE (to minimise the negative impact of COVID-19 on learning of young children through Government mainstream learning center) and it did not require any cost.;
